greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of circular permutations of length n without increasing or decreasing 3-sequences.
comment: Circular permutations are permutations whose indices are from the ring of integers modulo n. Increasing 3-sequences are of the form i,i+1,i+2, while decreasing 3-sequences are of the form i,i-1,i-2.
link: W. M. Dymacek, I. Lambert, Permutations Avoiding Runs of i, i+1, i+2 or i, i-1, i-2 , J. Int. Seq. 14 (2011) # 11.1.6, Table 1.
results.author: _Isaac Lambert_, Oct 07 2009
ext: Edited and more terms added by _Max Alekseyev_, Jun 14 2011
